column4: hi, I have a problem with dual monitor. The logon screen doesn't show on the screen that I wanted. Can anyone help me?
I have Nvidia graphics card
no, the primary display is on the correct one
everything is fine after logon
only on the login screen it's switched
i didn't have this problem with 9.04
Option         "metamodes" "DFP-0: nvidia-auto-select +0+0, DFP-1: nvidia-auto-select +1440+0"
what does it mean?
can i use this line to make DFP-0 be primary?
or it already is?
that's the available resolutions for two different monitors, and the location for 2nd screen
aren't you using nvidia?  the gui has a checkbox for primary monitor
this is kinda old but seems to apply https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/nvidia-graphics-drivers-180/+bug/396894
have you partitioned you system or are you using one big partition?  How much space do you have "df -h"?
No I have about 43gb spare
and only one partition?
Yeah
sorry - i have no idea then.
Could it be a codec issue?
?  i doubt it, but don't know for sure.
Could it be where it is being saved to?
possibly?
Not sure what I am doing wrong then
